title: 58 Best AI Tools to Try in 2024 (Always Up-to-Date)
content:
AI's taken a bite out of our workload—automating tasks and sparking creativity in fields like content writing and graphic design. 

New AI tools are popping up everywhere all the time, which can make it difficult to keep track. 

In this mega-guide, we'll break down the 58 best AI tools for various use cases to try in 2024.

[We update this list continuously to reflect the latest changes and releases.]

How We Select the Best AI Tools

Our list is based on extensive research, including in-depth analysis of dozens of expert reviews. 

We've also tested most of these tools ourselves, so we can give you a well-rounded perspective on their capabilities and functionalities.

The Best AI Tools and Software to Try in 2024

Even if you already use some AI tools, checking out the latest ones can give you a big advantage. 

We're going to explore some of the best AI tools out there, which we've broken down into different categories so you can find exactly what you need.

AI Content Creation Tools
AI Rewording Tools and Grammar Checkers
AI Tools for E-commerce
AI Task and Project Management Tools
AI Chatbots
AI Research Tools
AI Image Generators
AI Video Generators and Editors
AI for Voice and Music Generation
AI Design Tools
AI Podcast Tools
AI for Knowledge Management
AI Transcription and Meeting Assistants
AI Tools for Sales
AI Tools for Customer Support and Customer Service
AI Tools for HR and Recruiting
AI Coding Tools
AI Tools for Education
AI Character Generators
AI Tools for Email Inbox Management
AI Tools for Email Marketing
AI Presentation Builders
AI Scheduling Tools
AI Content Creation Tools

Struggling to keep up with the demand for fresh content? AI content creation tools speed up the way we generate text. Here are our picks.

1. ContentShake AI

ContentShake AI is a powerful writing tool that simplifies content creation by combining generative AI with real-world SEO data from Semrush.

The tool helps you:

Discover content ideas that resonate with your target audience
Create SEO-optimized articles quickly and easily
Generate engaging social media posts to promote your content
Generate high-quality AI images for your content

First, ContentShake AI analyzes your niche and your competition and suggests personalized content ideas proven to drive traffic.

Then, it helps you compose articles based on those ideas. The tool automatically finds and integrates target keywords and search intent insights into your blog posts. 

It also let you generate high-quality AI images for free.

ContentShake AI also provides real-time optimization tips to ensure your content is SEO-friendly and easy to read. 

It scores your content and suggests improvements to boost rankings and engagement. 

For example, ContentShake will take a long, jargon-filled sentence and rewrite it into a few short, easy-to-understand sentences. This makes your content more compelling for readers.

Finally, you can instantly turn your articles into catchy social media posts with a single click. This helps drive more traffic to your content.

This way, ContentShake AI simplifies every step—from generating ideas to publishing and promoting your content.

Key Features
The content idea generator finds trending topics for your business niche
The article generator creates unlimited SEO-rich blog posts optimized for your target keywords and search intent
One-click WordPress publishing lets you send articles directly to your website
Intuitive blog editor with an integrated AI chatbot
The content optimization feature improves your content’s SEO, readability and tone of voice 
Free Chrome extension generates content and improves your writing on the go
Pros and Cons

Pros:

A single convenient platform for finding content ideas, writing and optimizing content, and publishing it to your website
Enhances search engine rankings with Semrush's real-time SEO data
Offers useful free features like AI image generation and content optimization
Suitable for small businesses and teams of one

Cons:

Limited to content marketing use cases
Less suitable for large enterprises
Currently, it only generates content in English
Pricing

Explore ContentShake AI with a seven-day free trial.

After that, get the paid plan for $60/month and enjoy unlimited content creation.

2. Jasper

Jasper.ai was one of the original AI content generation tools. 

Its features—such as Brand Voice (for writing content in your target tone of voice) and Knowledge Base—make it ideal for enterprises and large-volume content needs.

It offers over 50 templates to streamline your content creation process: you can generate articles, emails, ads, product descriptions, and more. These templates make Jasper accessible to everyone.

For example, you can use the Blog Post Conclusion Paragraph template to draft a conclusion:

Top Features
Access to a dozen models including OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic
Custom "brand voice" based on your existing content generates content matching your brand's tone and style
30+ languages for global content localization
Real-time collaboration for teams with multiple user seats and shared document workspaces
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Chrome extension incorporates the full power of the tool
Offers multiple output-editing options for changing tone, changing length, and repurposing content 
Lets you toggle between Speed and Quality for your output

Cons:

Doesn’t offer real-time SEO or competitor data 
Lack of a free tier makes it pricey for individual or casual users 
Written output requires significant human input and editing
Pricing

The Creator plan with one seat costs $49/month. The Pro plan costs $69/month for each seat, and the Business plan offers custom pricing.

3. The AI Social Content Generator

The AI Social Content Generator available in the Semrush App Center helps you create engaging social media posts, captions, and hashtags within minutes. 

It generates ready-to-use videos from a single line of text. This makes it easy to produce content for Instagram reels, TikTok, and YouTube. 

You can also explore trending content from other brands on the same platform.

Top Features
Insights into competitors' best-performing posts and timings
Consistent brand identity across posts using your brand's color palette
Multiple content types including videos, carousels and posts
Unlimited posts, captions, and hashtags
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Provides content ideas to overcome creator's block
Offers a ton of templates to easily create trending, high-quality videos
Enables creation of content at scale for Facebook, Instagram, TikTok and more

Cons:

Cannot automatically post or schedule content to social media profiles
Video content is limited to the available templates, which may not fit all needs
Pricing

Check out Social Content Generator with a free trial. After that, it costs $35/month.

4. Narrato AI

Narrato AI can be a great option for all things content. From writing blogs and social media posts to creating AI images and turning your images into text with the AI image-to-text generator, this platform has all the AI tools you need.

Plus, you can create custom AI writing templates for your specific content creation needs. 

One unique feature is the AI autopilot for content creation - AI Content Genie. It auto-generates weekly social media posts and blog content, with no prompt or input required.

Simply add your website URL and target themes in the tool’s settings once, and it will automatically create relevant and fresh content based on this week after week.

Top Features
Access to over 100 AI writing templates and micro tools
Bulk content generation with AI
Auto-generated social media posts and blog articles with AI Content Genie
Easy content repurposing with AI, including images, video, and audio repurposing
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Grammar and plagiarism checking
Content planning, publishing, and workflow automation tools
Content collaboration features for teams of all sizes

Cons:

There is no free plan available. Users can try out the tool with the free trial
No native design tools. However, users can download the Narrato app on Canva.

Pricing

The Pro plan is priced at $36 per month, while the Business plan starts at $96. There’s also a custom pricing option available if you want less or more of something.

5. Copy.ai

Copy.ai is an AI-powered platform that automates content creation and marketing workflows for go-to-market teams.

Simply type out the processes you want to automate and the tool will help you do it at scale. For example, it can:

Create various types of content
Automate personalized sales prospecting
Streamline opportunity analysis and lead enrichment 
Generate competitive analysis assets like battle cards
Top Features
An extensive prompt library to get you started
Automated workflow creation for marketing and sales operations 
Works with various AI models like GPT 3.5, GPT 4, Azure, and Anthropic
Various templates for content creation (from content briefs to emails and ads)
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Integrates with over 2,000 tools
Provides robust features to automate sales and GTM processes
Supports over 90 languages for language translation

Cons

Complicated to set up and takes time to understand
Not ideal for small teams due to its complexity
Doesn’t offer data-driven features for SEO content creation 
Pricing

Copy.ai offers four plans: a Free plan, Pro at $49/month, Team at $249/month, and an Enterprise plan with custom pricing.

AI Rewording Tools and Grammar Checkers

AI rewording tools and grammar checkers can help you improve the clarity and accuracy of your writing. Let's explore how these tools can assist you with specific aspects of your writing process.

6. Semrush’s Free Paraphrasing Tool

The Semrush Paraphrasing tool makes it easy to adapt your content for different channels.

How?

The AI rewriting tool analyzes your original text and paraphrases it completely. 

The goal is to make your writing more clear, concise, and engaging. This helps to create content that's easy for all audiences to read and understand.

You can also use it to adapt content for various platforms and to write faster.

Top Features
Complex sentence simplification into clear, concise text
Content accessibility and appeal enhancement
Language and style adaptation for various audiences
Readability and tone of voice analysis and improvement
Pros and Cons

Pros

Helps ensure messaging consistency across different platforms
Saves time compared to manually rewriting content
Lets you track various metrics, such as word count, tone, and readability, to optimize content

Cons

Doesn’t have the option to select tone of voice
Automated suggestions may not always fit the intended meaning or style
Pricing

Free to use.

7. Semrush’s Online Proofreading Tool

The Semrush Free Online Proofreader helps refine your writing to better engage readers.

It analyzes your text and provides suggestions to improve clarity and concision. 

The tool highlights issues such as excessive pronouns, overly long sentences, and passive voice, as shown below.

By addressing these common weaknesses, you can make your content more direct and easier to understand. 

Top Features
Readability scores, style recommendations, and context-specific corrections
Detection of weak adverbs, passive voice, complex sentences, dull words, and other mistakes
Explanations of the rules behind each correction to teach you how to avoid them
Highlighting of hard-to-read sentences, passive voice, generic intensifiers, and other weak words
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Provides actionable feedback to tighten up your writing
Helps ensure your content is well-suited for online reading behaviors
Free to use, making it accessible to anyone looking to improve their writing

Cons:

Automated suggestions may not always align with your unique voice and style
Focuses mainly on sentence-level feedback as opposed to higher-level narrative flow
Pricing

Free to use.

8. ContentShake AI Writing Wizard

The ContentShake AI Writing Wizard is a Chrome extension to supercharge your editing process.

This tool offers multiple ways to optimize your writing, such as improving language, rephrasing sentences, and adjusting tone of voice. It uses AI to provide smart, context-aware suggestions. 

For example, you can use it to quickly polish your writing on any platform or website.

You can also ask it to create new content or perform other tasks using the “Custom request” feature.

Top Features
Compatible with any web platform and website for performing various AI writing tasks
Optimization of tone of voice and length
Summarization of complex ideas and concepts
Repurposing of the content for various social media platforms
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Integrates AI-powered editing tools into your natural writing workflow
Helps improve the tone of voice and style of your copy
Simplifies and paraphrases copy in a single click
Works on any website or platform

Cons:

AI suggestions may not always capture your intended meaning.
Free credits could run out quickly for high-volume writers.
The Chrome extension doesn’t offer the full ContentShake AI functionality.
Pricing

Users on the Free plan get 50 credits/month.

The extension is free without limits for all ContentShake AI’s Unlimited Plan users.

9. Grammarly

Grammarly is a writing assistant that goes beyond basic spelling and grammar checks. 

For example, it also gives vocabulary enhancement suggestions to improve word choice and flow, like this:

You can also set writing goals such as Audience, Formality, and Domain to tailor the feedback you get from it.

Top Features
Correctness checks, tone suggestions, and full sentence rewrites to clean up hard-to-read sentences
Shared guidelines to help teams sound consistent
Custom style guides, with profile options for tone, formality, and professional relevance, adapt to your voice using generative AI
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Works on multiple desktop and mobile platforms, browsers, and apps
Uses AI to analyze your text and gives developmental feedback with strategic suggestions on how to make it better
Includes a built-in plagiarism checker to make sure everything is original

Cons:

Suggests what it deems as the best alternative, without giving options
Sometimes misunderstands the context of your writing
Pricing

Grammarly Premium costs $30/month. Grammarly Business plans cost $25/month/user.

10. Wordtune

Wordtune helps you improve your writing on the go. 

It uses natural language processing to understand the context and semantics of the text. 

It then provides suggestions to rewrite, rephrase, or change the tone of your sentences.

Wordtune goes a step further than standard error correction by providing developmental feedback. 

The Spices feature makes content more catchy, for example, by adding an analogy or counterargument.

Top Features
Automated suggestions for more concise, vivid, and varied word choices to improve your writing style
A browser extension and integration with popular writing tools such as Google Docs, Microsoft Word
Translation of text from languages such as Spanish, Mandarin, or Arabic into English
Analysis of sentence structure, word choice and grammar to identify any potential issues
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Allows you to adjust the tone of your writing to be more formal or casual
Summarizes uploaded documents

Cons:

Raises concerns over privacy, since the Wordtune browser extension can access all the content on web pages you visit
May not handle complex technical writing or specialized domains as well as general writing.
Pricing

The Advanced plan with one seat costs $13.99/month. The Unlimited plan costs $19.99/month for each seat, and the Business plan offers custom pricing. There is a free plan available.

AI Tools for E-commerce

AI tools offer powerful solutions to streamline tasks and enhance the customer experience for your online store. Have a look at these tools:

11. Ecommerce Booster

Ecommerce Booster is an AI-powered tool designed to help optimize your Shopify store and boost sales.

How does it work?

First, it conducts a comprehensive audit of your store to identify areas for improvement in your product pages, images, and overall user experience. 

It then provides a prioritized list of tasks to tackle these issues.

But Ecommerce Booster goes beyond just giving recommendations. Its built-in AI tools help you quickly generate product descriptions, enhance images, and more.

In this way, you can spend less time on tedious optimizations and more time growing your business.

Top Features
AI Boost provides instant improvement
Task prioritization lets you manage tasks quickly to find the biggest growth points
Progress tracker updates as you complete tasks
Bi-weekly audit updates on the most severe issues or on your top-performing pages help you to stay on top of things
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Provides a clear, actionable plan to improve your store based on expert analysis
Includes AI-powered tools to automate time-consuming tasks such as description writing.
Ensures your store is optimized for speed, accessibility, and conversions.

Cons:

Requires consistent effort to implement suggestions and maintain optimization.
As with any AI tool, outputs may require human review and editing for accuracy.
Pricing

Limited free plan available, after which it costs $49.99/month.

12. Ads Launch Assistant

The Ads Launch Assistant is a tool that simplifies the process of launching Google Ads campaigns.

It provides tailored suggestions for keywords, ad copy, extensions, and UTM tags. 

This allows even those new to advertising to quickly set up campaigns without needing to develop deep expertise.

You can then launch and manage your campaigns using its intuitive interface. 

The tool automatically optimizes your ad performance to maximize results while saving your budget.

Top Features
Top matching keywords, auto-generated headlines, ad copy, extensions, and UTM tags.
Advanced AI ad generator and Semrush data help you to set up campaigns and get high-quality suggestions at every step of the ad management process.
AI-generated ad copy.
High-quality suggestions, using Semrush data,
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Lowers the barrier to entry for those new to Google Ads
Provides AI-powered suggestions for quick campaigns
Includes clear reporting to monitor and optimize performance
Let’s you maximize your ad results for just 10% of your ad spend
Provides a $500 giveaway with your first campaign

Cons:

Still requires some knowledge to ensure campaigns are properly targeted
Requires human judgment on spend limits
Pricing

Free to use.

13. AdCreative.ai

AdCreative also streamlines the creation of high-converting ad content.

It can generate ad creatives, headlines, and copy tailored to your specific advertising platforms. 

The tool also provides insights into your best-performing ads and even allows you to analyze your competitors' ads.

Top Features
Conversion-optimized ad creatives for various platforms.
Engaging social media post creatives sized for each network.
AI-generated video ads and enhanced product photoshoots.
Scores for ad creatives to predict performance before launching campaigns.
Analysis of competitors' ads to gain insights and inspire new strategies.
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Saves significant time in the ad creation process.
Integrates with major advertising platforms for seamless workflow.
Supports collaboration with multiple user accounts.

Cons:

Requires extensive human oversight to ensure ads align with overall strategy.
May have a steep learning curve for those new to using AI tools in advertising.
Pricing

AdCreative offers four plans: a free trial, Startup at $29/month, Professional at $209/month, and Agency at $549/month/user.

AI Task and Project Management Tools

Juggling multiple tasks and projects can be overwhelming. 

AI task and project management tools can help you stay organized, boost efficiency, and meet deadlines. 

Let's see how these tools can simplify your workflow.

14. Asana

Asana offers AI-powered features under the umbrella of Asana Intelligence.

These features make project management easier and improve team productivity. 

Asana includes tools such as Smart Fields, which auto-generates custom fields based on project content. 

Asana Intelligence also uses Smart Summaries, which highlight key action items from tasks and comments. 

Top Features
AI writing assistant provides suggestions and edits to improve the clarity and tone of messages
Smart Status provides comprehensive status reports for active projects
Real-time answers and insights about projects
AI chart generation provides automatic visualizations of your data
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Saves time by automating routine tasks such as note-taking and status updates
Improves clarity by summarizing key information and action items
Improves accountability with transparent, data-driven status reports
Allows natural language queries for quick insights into projects

Cons:

AI summarization may miss nuances or context from human communication.
AI features may not be as helpful if Asana usage is lightweight.
Pricing

The Starter plan with one seat costs $13.49/month. 

The Advanced plan costs $30.49/month for each seat, and the Enterprise and Enterprise+ plans offer custom pricing. There is a free plan available.

15. Any.do

With Any.do, you can manage tasks and projects with AI. 

It combines calendar and task management within the My Day section, which lets you easily keep track of your daily priorities. 

It also has AI-driven boards that learn from your context, preferences, and patterns to recommend checklists and other tools. 

In your Personal lists, the AI analyzes complex tasks and suggests breaking them into smaller action items as manageable subtasks. 

Top Features
Voice entry for hands-free task adding.
Flexible reminders that can be one-off, repeat, and location-specific.
Works across devices like desktops, phones, and tablets.
Customizable workflow templates help you get started.
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Integrates with tools such as Slack, Trello, and Google Meet, making workflows easier.
Its colorful and minimalist interface helps you manage tasks and projects with ease.
Allows basic collaboration features like shared lists and task assignments.

Cons:

Current AI features focus on basic suggestions and scheduling, not complex project management tasks.
Doesn't offer detailed reports on project progress or team performance.
AI features only available on Premium plans.
Pricing

The Premium plan costs $5.99/month. The Family plan for four users costs $9.99/month, and the Teams plan costs $7.99/month/user. There is a free Personal plan available.

AI Chatbots

Ever chatted with a virtual assistant online? Those are AI chatbots. Let's explore how these tools can automate tasks.

16. ChatGPT

OpenAI’s ChatGPT offers tasks related to writing, data analysis, code generation, brainstorming, and more.

Say you're looking for ways to promote your pet insurance company on social media. Here's what ChatGPT might suggest:

At the time of its launch, ChatGPT had the fastest-growing user base of all time, and is credited with making AI mainstream. 

Since then, its capabilities have only grown. OpenAI recently introduced ChatGPT-4o—its fastest free model.

ChatGPT is multimodal, which means it accepts text, audio, image, and video inputs and generates text, audio, and image outputs.

These latest developments convert ChatGPT from a chat tool into an AI companion that understands your needs and responds in real-time.

Top Features
Image, code, and text generation
Text, audio, image, and video inputs accepted
Memory feature remembers topics you discuss across all chats
Customized versions can be created for specific purposes, such as editing
Lets you create custom GPTs and train them the way you want 
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Includes voice input on mobile
Allows you to upload files and images for analysis
Useful for brainstorming and generating visual and textual content
Offers a robust free plan 
The pain plan includes AI image generation using DALL-E 3

Cons:

Requires prompt-writing skills to get the output you want
The text output can sound robotic an d needs a lot of tweaking
Can reflect biases present in its training data, potentially leading to discriminatory or offensive outputs
Pricing

ChatGPT offers a free plan for GPT-3.5 and GPT-4o. 

The premium subscription, ChatGPT Plus, priced at $20/month, provides access to the GPT-4 model, faster response times, priority access to new features, and AI image generation. 

The ChatGPT Enterprise (API) plan is priced per token, with 1,000 tokens costing roughly $0.002, and supports a 16K context window.

17. Llama 3 by Meta

Llama 3 by Meta is a powerful open-source large language model that can understand and respond to complex instructions. 

It's free to use and comes in two different sizes, depending on the number of parameters, which impacts the tasks they can perform and their processing speed. 

Meta has integrated Llama 3 into their AI assistant, Meta AI, making it Llama 3 is available across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger. 

This means you can get things done, learn new information, and stay connected within the apps you already use. 

Here’s an example of asking Meta AI on WhatsApp for tips to become healthier:

This way, Meta offers helpful suggestions throughout the day.

Top Features
Available in two sizes—8 billion parameters and 70 billion parameters which means it works well on small and large devices
The 8,000-token context window allows it to recall past info
Open-source language model: Allows users to download and run it on their own computers or on cloud infrastructures 
Pros and Cons

Pros: 

Free and accessible to a wide range of users
Writes content, poems, code, scripts, and more
Can animate images or turn them into GIFs

Cons:

Open-source LLMs can be difficult to maintain and ensure quality
There are concerns related to security and data privacy due to its open-source nature
Pricing

Llama 3 is an open source model, making it free to download and use for research and commercial purposes.

18. Claude 3

Claude Pro, from Anthropic AI, is a powerful AI chatbot designed for professional use. It’s great for tasks like information analysis and content creation.

Claude is especially great at capturing a natural tone of voice. Its writing output is also less fluffy than other chatbots. 

Top Features
Analysis of uploaded PDFs and images.
Clipboard stores your pasted data for easier reference.
Context window of 200k tokens (about 850 pages of text) which allows it to recall large amounts of background information.
Three models (Opus, Sonnet, and Haiku) with different power ranges. Opus is the most capable but slowest, and Haiku is the fastest and most affordable.
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Excels at creative writing, producing novel and nuanced content
Gives you direct and concise answers with fewer headings and summaries
Less prone to the strict content filters and limitations of other AI chatbots

Cons:

Lacks features like plugins, image generation, or a code interpreter
Doesn’t let you edit your earlier prompts in the conversation, unlike Gemini or ChatGPT
Not available in certain locations
If you ask it to regenerate the output, you cannot view previous outputs
Pricing

Claude offers a free version. For $20/month, Claude Pro will give you five times more usage. 

API pricing varies based on the Claude model and the number of tokens. 

19. Gemini

Google’s Gemini is another great ChatGPT alternative. It integrates directly with G-Suite. This integration with Google products like Pixel devices makes the AI accessible. 

Gemini is great at holding natural and informative conversations. It also provides links for the specific sources it draws information or news from.

It understands complex questions and requests and generates more creative and nuanced writing than other chatbots. 

It can engage in creative writing tasks as well as informative conversations and complex analysis. 

For example, if asked to write a creative ad copy for our pet insurance platform, Gemini might produce something like this:

Top Features
The large context window of 128K allows it to maintain longer conversations
Voice input on desktop and mobile
G-Suite integration
Compatible with texts, images, and audio
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Fast response time
Adapts communication style based on user preferences and context
Enhances workflows through content generation and integration with Google products

Cons:

Lags behind other AI assistants in coding and programming tasks
Internal workings remain somewhat opaque, making it challenging to understand fully how it arrives at its responses
Lacks AI image generation
Often takes time to understand your query 
Pricing

The free version of Google Gemini is available for all Google Workspace users. 

You can also get a free two-month trial of its Advanced plan, with all its features and capabilities. After that, a subscription to Gemini Advanced will cost $19.99/month.

AI Research Tools

AI research tools gather information and analyze data better. Let's see how AI can streamline your research process.

20. Perplexity

Perplexity AI is an AI-powered search engine and research assistant.

You can filter your search by a wide range of sources:

Perplexity synthesizes results from multiple sources to provide accurate, up-to-date information. 

It provides numbered references and citations for the sources it uses. You can also validate information and explore additional context.

Top Features
Streamlined research, using text summaries and extraction of key information from complex documents.
Integration with multiple AI models such as GPT-4, Claude 2.1, Perplexity, and Gemini to provide comprehensive results, including sources, images, related questions, and videos.
A wide range of sources beyond just websites, including academic journals, industry reports, and social media discussions.
Real-time updates and breaking news, by continuously crawling the web.. 
Pros and Cons
Pros
Includes convenient features like Folders/Collections to organize queries
Uses Perplexity's ability to identify relationships between concepts and visualize knowledge graphs for a deeper comprehension of your research area
Summarization and citation recommendation features make reviewing relevant academic literature easier
Cons
Sometimes struggles to link various pieces of information to provide a comprehensive understanding of a topic or question
Performs poorly at summarizing articles, often just providing a bare-bones summary
Pricing

Perplexity offers a free plan with standard features. Perplexity Pro costs $20/month, although a seven-day free trial is available with the yearly subscription plan, which costs $200.

21. Papertalk

Papertalk AI is a tool that helps people understand research papers. 

It turns complicated scientific papers into easy to understand summaries. 

It also provides personalized recommendations for relevant research papers and materials based on your interests and previous interactions.

Top Features
Collaboration tools for teamworking on research projects, share materials, and discuss findings with others
Research summaries, provide users with clear explanations and actionable insights from complex academic literature
Audiobook format available for summaries, so you can listen instead of reading.
AI-powered chatbot provides instant assistance
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Helpful for people short on time or who find scientific papers difficult to read
Automates tasks like literature searches and data extraction
Searches a wider range of sources than you may be able to find on your own

Cons:

AI limitations or biases could impact the quality of the summaries generated
Limited control over the summarization process may be a concern for those who need specific details or nuances in their summaries
Pricing

Uploading and analyzing up to 10 papers is free. Beyond that, custom pricing is available.

22. Fillout

Fillout AI is an online tool that helps you create forms. 

Instead of building the form yourself, Fillout suggests layouts and questions based on what you're trying to achieve. 

It can also make your form look stylish by matching it to a brand image you provide.

Top Features
Personalized research forms to align with brand identity
Analytical tools that track form performance and manage responses
Integrations and webhooks to automate workflows 
Custom form templates tailored to specific research needs
Over 40 different question types that users can easily incorporate into research forms
Seamless integration with various apps and databases, including Airtable, Google Sheets, and Notion, allowing researchers to efficiently gather and manage data
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Frees up researchers' time for analysis
Automates repetitive tasks such as data extraction and form filling
Handles large datasets and complex forms

Cons:

Security of sensitive research data entrusted to an AI tool needs careful consideration
Can struggle with complex data and qualitative research methods
Pricing

Fillout offers four plans: a free plan, Starter at $15/month, Pro at $40/month, and Business at $75/month.

AI Image Generators

Imagine creating unique images with just a few words. AI image generators can do just that. See how these tools can improve visual content creation.

23. Midjourney

Midjourney is an AI image generation tool that allows you to create stunning visuals based on text descriptions.

In 2022, AI art produced by Midjourney controversially won a prize in Colorado State Fair’s annual art competition.

Midjourney’s output quality is arguably the highest quality of all image generators. 

When prompted to create <a photo of a gray cat with wings flying in the sky Canon EF 35mm, f1. 8, photography high on details, ultra-realistic, HD, HDR, 8K, real-life --ar 3:2>,  this is what Midjourney came up with:

Currently, Midjourney can only be accessed through the Discord chat. But it’s worth signing up for the creative possibilities it offers.

Top Features
Detailed prompts describing the desired image, including style, composition, and elements.
A wide range of styles, from photo realistic to abstract and painterly.
Generated images can be refined by your feedback.
A strong online user community that shares prompts, discusses techniques, and collaborates on projects.
Pros and Cons

Pros:

Creates high-quality, artistic and hyper-realistic images.
Provides inspiration, feedback, and collaboration via a vibrant user community.
Allows you to fine-tune aspect ratio, color palette, and level of detail for precise control.

Cons:

It requires a lot of practice and time to get good at crafting effective prompts. 
Operates through a Discord interface, which some users might find difficult to use initially.
Pricing

24. DALL-E 3 (with ChatGPT Plus)

OpenAI’s DALL-E 3 allows you to create stunning, highly realistic images from text-based prompts. 

Compared to previous versions, DALL-E 3 understands complex instructions and can incorporate details such as object positioning and quantity. 

In response to the same prompt — <A photo of a gray cat with wings flying in the sky Canon EF 35mm, f1. 8, photography high on details, ultra-realistic, HD, HDR, 8K, real-life --ar 3:2> — DALL-E 3 produced the following image:

DALL-E 3’s output isn’t as realistic as Midjourney’s, but could be especially useful for casual use. If you’re looking for something more advanced, Midjourney is the way to go. Otherwise DALL-E 3 is an easier option. 

Its safety features are still under development though which may leave it open to misuse. 

For example, in December 2023, an AI engineer at Microsoft discovered that DALL-E 3 has vulnerabilities that let users create violent and explicit images by bypassing safety guardrails.

Currently, access to DALL-E 3 is limited to ChatGPT Plus users. Its capacity is also limited to 40 requests every three hours.

46. Knewton

Knewton AI personalizes learning by figuring out what a student already knows and what they need to learn.

Based on this, Knewton creates custom practice problems and learning paths for each student. 

This can help students learn at their own pace and focus on areas where they struggle. 

Knewton AI isn't a separate program students use. Instead, it integrates into other educational platforms.

Top Features
Customized learning paths for each student, tailoring the content, pace, and style to their individual needs and learning preferences
Diagnostic tests that assess students' knowledge gaps and strengths, and adjust learning content and activities to address those gaps in real-time

Tailors practice problems to each student's needs

Teachers can use data to track student progress and make instructional decisions about what to teach next

Cons:

Technical problems can disrupt learning
Can be difficult for teachers to understand how Knewton is making its recommendations
Pricing

Knewton AI offers three pricing plans. Monthly at $10.95/month, gives the flexibility to cancel anytime. Single-Term Access offers access to a single course for a term at $44.95.
AltaPass for $89.95 gives students access to multiple courses within a subject domain for up to two years.

There's also a 14-day courtesy access available for students waiting on financial aid.

Mailbutler is an add-on for your existing email service like Gmail or Outlook. It helps you manage your inbox more efficiently. 

For example, you can schedule emails to be sent later or snooze emails you don't need to deal with right away. 

This helps you stay on top of important messages and avoid a cluttered inbox. 

Mailbutler also includes an AI assistant that helps you write emails faster and know whether recipients have opened your messages.

Personalized email responses, summaries of lengthy email threads, and automated writing suggestions

50. SaneBox

SaneBox is a tool that helps you tame your inbox by automatically sorting emails. It uses AI to analyze your emails and move less important messages to a separate folder called SaneLater.

This keeps your main inbox focused on important emails that require immediate attention.

This can be helpful for people who receive a high volume of emails and struggle to stay on top of them all.

It also provides examples to guide users in selecting the right target audience, presentation objective, and visual style. Decktopus also allows users to collaborate on and share the AI-generated presentations.

One-click design features and auto-adjusted layouts simplify the customization process.

FAQs
Why Do I Need to Use AI Tools in 2024?

The amount of information and tasks we juggle is growing. 

AI steps in to automate repetitive tasks, analyze complex data, and even spark creative ideas—all at lightning speed. 

This frees you up to focus on what humans do best: using your intuition, judgment, and creativity for high-level problem-solving and strategic thinking. 

AI can also help you be more productive—whether it's generating reports in a flash or suggesting personalized content for your customers. 

Basically, AI is there to empower you, not replace you. It's the ultimate teammate for getting more done and achieving your goals

How Can I Find the Best AI Writing Tool?

With so many AI writing tools out there, choosing the right one can feel daunting.

First, identify your writing needs. Do you churn out short, snappy social media captions, or craft lengthy blog posts? Maybe you need help with emails or website copy. Different tools excel in different areas.

Next, prioritize the features that matter most. Is grammar perfection your holy grail, or do you crave streamlined SEO optimization? Some offer long-form content assistance, while others specialize in specific content types.

Research is key. Read reviews from trusted sources and explore the tools' websites. Many offer free trials — test-drive the features and see if the writing style aligns with your voice.

What Are the Best AI Tools?

The industry is changing fast, making it impossible to pinpoint the "best" option. 

For example, you could’ve started with ChatGPT, and now use a mix of Perplexity, Claude, ContentShake AI, and Gemini. 

As the technology gets better and more companies start taking advantage of it, it's crucial to stay open to new options, and test them against your needs. 

What works for one user may not fit another. 

In a nutshell: keep experimenting with different tools and stay updated on the latest developments to find the best AI solutions for your projects.

How Can We Improve Our Small Business with AI Tools?

AI tools can give your small business an edge. 

How? 

Start by identifying time-consuming or repetitive tasks, such as handling customer inquiries or managing social media. 

You can automate these processes by implementing AI-powered chatbots and marketing tools, which allow your team to focus on more complex, high-value tasks.

AI can also help you manage your finances. AI-assisted bookkeeping and financial management software can streamline your accounting processes and reduce errors. 

Inventory management is another area where AI can make a difference. AI analyzes past sales data, predicts future demand, and optimizes your stock levels accordingly. You always have the right products on hand without tying up too much capital.

Choose the Best AI Tools for Your Business

The AI revolution is here, and it's transforming the way we work. 

From content creation to project management, these powerful tools drive productivity and creativity to new heights. 

But it can be overwhelming to decide which one to start with.
